Articles.Content:
Anyone interested in a Thread about Planetary Occultation?

What is Occultation?
Planets/Moons overlapping each other or the parent Star.
Stuff like this:
Saturn's Rhea and Dione
[IMG]https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/b/b3/Dione_Rhea_Occultation.jpg[/IMG]
Io over Jupiter
[IMG]https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/6/65/PIA02879_-_A_New_Year_for_Jupiter_and_Io.jpg[/IMG]

Why to start such a thread?
Because I saw my first Kerbin Eclipse accompanied by the Mun and I was wondering what awesome Screenshots might be out there on the Topic.
So feel free to post them :) (Mods are allowed)

Here it goes:
Kerbin and Mun (seen from Minmus)
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/pEbA9R9.jpg[/IMG]

Eve-Transit over Kerbol (Distant Object Enhancement-Mod)
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Mzn5pZ2.jpg[/IMG] Edited November 24, 2015 by MalfunctionM1Ke

You may be suffering from a lack of planetary occultation photography; many probably see it momentarily, and after an "oh, neat" move on to the next step.

But if I take any that are note-worthy, I will post them here!

The following are not the best of images, but I thought it was a pretty neat event to witness. I happened to catch Laythe eclipsing the Sun while my probe was descending through the atmosphere of Jool. Right next to Laythe is another moon, but I don't remember if it was Vall or Tylo. The descent almost lasted long enough for the second moon to also eclipse the sun, but my probe imploded just before first contact. The big dark spot is the heat shield of my probe.




 

Edited December 1, 2015 by OhioBob
fixed images
If you want the best occultations, the Jool system is definitely where you should go.

[IMG]http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/3264294907256695311/31E451515B1EEBE27BFA5CA8C1E186FDA77C03F7/[/IMG]



Several versions ago I caught Eve slipping behind Kerbin from Kerbin orbit with the Tarsier tech space telescope. Edited November 26, 2015 by Aethon

Saturn occultation:
